lines.text: No, don't yell hey at that horse!
Well, well, hark ye, friends, roommates, countrymen, lend me your cheers.
[Crowd of frat boys yell "Yeah!"]
Oh, such rapturous greetings warms the chilled heart of your noble King!
[Crowd yells "Long Live the King!"]
I'll take the Queen!
I thought you would. Now, hark ye, while I give to you the privileges of the season, there shall be no amusement tax on necking!
[Crowd roars!]
Oh boy, any good neckin' in sight for this year?
And why should this year be different?
Guy, it's the same ole room. Just as clean as a garage sink.
Yes, but it's home sweet home to us.
You betcha!
Whoa, boy, where'd you get the swell rag?
Do you like it?
Gee, that's a wow!
I thought it would look swell with those big banjo eyes.
Why, you couldn't take a femme from me, blonde, brunette, red, gray, or bald.
I not only take 'em from you, but, I find you every honey you get. Why, if it weren't for me you'd be playing the old ladies home and not doing so well either.
What women want, that's me.
[Picks up the phone]
Yeah, ask her if her daughter's got a date for the night.

[Noticing Babs sorority pin]
Oh, the Pi Phi house. Well, I'll be around tonight about eight.
Am I supposed to burst our cheering?
Not till after the first treatment.

[Sarcastically]
Oh, I can hardly wait.
Don't be impatient! Goodbye.
You don't mean to tell me that an unprotected girl like yourself is going to be seen going to the Campus Candy Store in broad daylight!
Well, why not? Is it so terrible?

Terrible? Why I, alone, have dragged from that opiate-reeking atmosphere the bodies of innocent young girls, their sallow complexions give testimony to the lives they have lived. Sinful slaves to the chocolate drop. Shameful addicts to the bon-bons.
Oh, have no fear. Tonight, at the stroke of eight, I will arrive at?
Pi Phi House.
And will I be welcome on the mat - outside?
Em-hmm... and inside, too.
Say, don't wisecrack.
Oh, you're gonna get high-hat with me over a girl, huh?
Yes I am.
Think you've landed a little exclusive necking.
She isn't that kind of a girl.
Oh, don't make me laugh. Wait'll I put the works on her.
Whoopie-wow!
Heaven help the buzzard who stole that box of candy!

[Doorbell rings]
Oh, pardon me, I think that's for me.
Oh, are you expecting somebody else?
Well, em, I am, rather.
Fine, you bring him in and I'll throw him out.
Now that we're all here, I've got a great idea. Let's play Post Office.
Oh, that's a kid's game.
Not the way I play it!
You know, Babs, every time I look at Biff I can figure out why girls walk home.
[Babs laughs]
And you're the reason they run home!
Say, Babs, are you all dated up for the Glee Club hop?
No. I've been waiting for somebody to ask me. Somebody, in particular.
Ha-ha-ha. Gee, that's great! Well, consider yourself asked.
Who let you back in this country?
Aw, don't get hard boiled, Biffy. Remember, you're only a three-minute egg.
Yeah, you and small pox are my favorite diseases.
Waste not the hours with yonder young horse pistol.
Don't while the night with nothingness with that numb-scullion.
Oh, I beseech thee, young lady, put your okay on me.
I know, we'll settle this as if the fearless knights of old.
What do you mean?
Battle to the death and the victor shall be my escort to the hop.
Well, alright, you think you're the white-haired boy, now, don't cha? But, you wait. I'm like the undertaker, I get 'em in the end!
Aw, don't be silly Biff. You know I like you.
You don't show it.
Well, what do you want me to do? Tattoo your name on my chest?
Oh, Babs, I wish you wouldn't talk like that. I only wanted to tell you, that I - oh, gee, I'm all balled up.
I'll be with you in half a shake, Babs.
You and I've been through a thousand female campaigns together.
Yeah, boy!
We've shared our girls like we've shared our neckties.
Well, I didn't know you felt that way about her, kid. That's different. Well, if that's the way it is, this is station M E signing off.
So, Eddie's getting your goat. Passing you up, eh?
Eddie what's the matter with you lately? Are you afraid of me?
Yeah, I'm afraid you'll bite me.
Ha-ha. You know I'm a vegetarian.
Good night, honey baby.
Alright, gang! Biff and Eddie, Three! Biff and Eddie! Raw! Raw! Raw! Biff and Eddie! Yeah!
Babs, I, I want you to wear my fraternity pin at the game tomorrow. Will you?
I got it bad over you.
Babs, one little kiss, to remember me in the morning?
No, somebody might see us.
Oh, just a little quickie!
Sit down, eggs! Before I scramble ya!
